title: Mass Antisemitic Rally In Front Of Munich Synagogue Calls For Israel Eradication
message:
Nearly 4,000 anti-Israel protestors turned up on Saturday in front of the main Munich synagogue demanding the obliteration of the Jewish state, according to German media reports.
A mix of German Muslim, leftist and mainstream Germans appeared at the mass rally, according to the online German news organization NIUS.
There has been scarce resistance to rising antisemitism in the southern German city of Munich in the state of Bavaria.
He will not ban the Palestine Committee Stuttgart because he is not allowed to do that.
Israeli lawyers told i24 that Nopper can delete all postings of NGOs, including Palestine Committee Stuttgart, on the city website to ensure that the city does not enable Palestine Committee Stuttgart to finance the terrorist entities, Hamas and Samidoun.
event_breakdown:
1. A mass rally of nearly 4,000 anti-Israel protestors takes place in Munich, Germany, demanding the obliteration of the Jewish state.
2. The German city of Munich has faced scarce resistance to rising antisemitism.
3. The mayor of the German city of Munich, Dieter Nopper, will not ban the Palestine Committee Stuttgart, an organization that supports the Boycott, Divestment, Sanctions (BDS) movement.
4. Israeli lawyers argue that Nopper should delete all postings of NGOs, including the Palestine Committee Stuttgart, from the city website to ensure that the city does not support the terrorist entities Hamas and Samidoun.
